resources.string: <g id="g_grace_shrugdontcare" />One thing I don't miss from the old world - it was ambition for a man to chase a fortune, but greed for a woman.
<g id="g_grace_understand" />That way of thinking doesn't hold much water on Aeternum, so that's something.
The Silver Crows
Grace O'Malley has developed a plan to found an enterprising new group of heroes who can work together to face the threats of Aeternum and possibly earn a little coin in the process.
<g id="g_grace_casualhail" />Good to see you again, mate. Feels like there's been a lull in us adventuring together!
<g id="g_grace_gesturelefts" />I've been thinking, new threats keep rising up here…<g id="g_grace_headtilthmm" /> maybe we need a plan that takes that into account.
"Give up on escaping Aeternum?"
<g id="g_grace_dismiss" />Grace O'Malley never gives up! I just changed my mind.<g id="g_grace_shrugdontknow" /> It's not so bad on Aeternum, long as there's good company and good coin.
<g id="g_grace_consider" />So I'm thinking we build on your reputation and start a heroes for hire sort of affair.
"Save Aeternum and get paid?"
<g id="g_grace_chuckle" />Ah yeah, we're sailing with the same wind!<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> We'd recruit the island's best talent, maybe call the operation "Silver Crows."
<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" />You'd captain the gang with me as First Mate<g id="g_grace_gestureleftm" /> - I'd even give you double share on prizes. What do you say?
"I'm in. We just need a hideout."
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />This camp's not much, but it beats that drafty old Caer Dun, and<g id="g_grace_gesturel" /> we can expand later, call it the Crow's Nest.
<g id="g_grace_no" />Only problem is some of those red-eyed bastards camping nearby. You clear them<g id="g_grace_yes" /> out, we're in business.
<g id="g_grace_concerns" priority="high" />These pesky Corrupted keep turning up everywhere.<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> I'm starting to get used to it.
Drive the Corrupted away from the outskirts of the Crow's Nest
Collect Supplies for Crows' Nest
Burn the Corrupted Tents
Use your supplies to build the Crow's Nest
Silver Crows
Crow's Nest Built
You've built a home base for the Silver Crows
<g id="g_grace_gesturearound" priority="high" />Now we got a safe place for the Silver Crows to call home! It's time to start expanding the crew and earning some coin!
<g id="g_grace_no" />I'd swear I've crossed this entire island ten times now, so I'll<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" /> handle this place<g id="g_grace_chuckle" /> - you do the footwork.
Skye the Speardaughter
Grace has already lined up a first engagement for the Silver Crows. Learn about your mission and meet the customer in Great Cleave.
Ah, I hope you'll forgive me, but I was floating your name around even before we shook on this deal.
It's a lodestone for business, I tell you, so I've already lined up our first client - a Celtic speardaughter named Skye.
"What does Skye need help with?"
Skye and her partner got cursed by a Varangian Warlock - probably something to do with this new contingent called "The Forged."
Some grim tidings coming from Great Cleave lately. This Skye, she seems desperate.
"I should speak with her."
No doubt, but make sure to read Skye's letter first, hear the tale in her own words.
Then head out to find her, and her spear-sister, in Great Cleave. Good luck, and may fortune smile on us all with this business.
Keep me posted on how things go with Skye. This is our first client, so we need to make a good impression.
Read Skye's letter
Find Skye and her partner in Great Cleave
Meet Skye and her partner in Great Cleave

string.comment: could gasp in pain before this line - she and Aidyn ran from a battle where they were overwhelmed- both weakened by the curse
string.speaker: Skye
string.name: SpearDaughterSkye

resources.string: Please… please, I need help! Are you from the Silver Crows? Yes, thank the gods you're here.

string.comment: could gasp in pain before this line - she and Aidyn ran from a battle where they were overwhelmed- both weakened by the curse
string.speaker: Skye
string.name: SpearDaughterSkye

resources.string: My spear-sister and I… we were scouting the Varangians' position to give you a start… but they caught on.
"What happened?"
Ambush. They sent a band of brutes around to surprise us... Aidyn and I were running, and then I lost her.
You must find her quickly, she may be in trouble.
I'll be fine - just go find Aidyn!
Retrace Skye's steps to search for her partner Aidyn
The ground here is marked with signs of a struggle. A separate set of tracks leads downhill.
Follow the tracks to search for Skye's partner Aidyn
Aidyn's trail stops at the edge of the cliff. You catch a tiny glint of metal far below.
Investigate the shiny object on the ground
Defeat the Forged ambush
Recover Aidyn's Brooch and the message left for Skye
All you found is her brooch? Did she get herself captured?
Ah, a message too… Beira's teeth! She's gone mad, decided she's going after the warlock on her own!
"Why would she do that?"
Aidyn's always been overproud. Her warrior's fire blazed brightest… until that Faceless bastard stole it.
She wasn't happy when I asked for help… but with the curse, Faceless will swat her away like a fly.
"We'll have to find him first."
That's the spirit I'm looking for! And when we find him, my spear will drink its fill of his heart's blood. I swear it on the west and east!
The Curse of the Faceless One
Skye seeks a way to lift the curse on herself and other victims of the Varangians.
First thing we need to do is lift this damn curse and get my fire back.
There's a sorceress in these parts named Shailyn - she knows about the Varangians' dark hexes. She's got answers I need.
"I'll go. You need to rest."
You'd do that for me? I made the right choice, seeking you out.
Alright, I'll head to your Crow's Nest camp. Learn what you can from Shailyn and then meet me back there.
I feel the darkness of Faceless's curse weigh down my neck, heavy as Beira's hammer.
Aidyn thinks with her heart, first. She'll be back, I'm sure of it.
Talk to the sorceress Shailyn to see if she can help lift Skye's curse
If you've come seeking treasures from the Empyrean forge, you should abandon that notion.
It's been claimed by a ruthless band of Varangian raiders… their methods are cruel and their magic is malignant.
"Do you know how to lift a curse."
Is this about the speardaughter? She ran afoul of Hróaldr - the Faceless one. I am all too familiar with his sadistic power.
The warlock himself has not been here, but I have seen warriors wearing his bone talismans.
"Are those related to the curse?"
Exactly, Hróaldr drains the warrior's fire from his victims and infuses the bone talismans to strengthen himself and his soldiers.
Collect and destroy the talismans to restore the victims' fire. That's the only cure I know of.
I wonder if Aeternum will ever be rid of the legacy of the proud Knights of the Round Table.
That one of them now marches with the Varangians… Artorius would be crushed to learn his faith was so misplaced.
Defeat Varangian Soldiers to collect Bone Talismans made by Faceless
Return to the Crow's Nest to show Skye the Bone Talismans
That seemed fast! Perhaps because Grace is lifting my spirits, regaling me with news of the old world, and tales of your exploits, of course.
Please tell me... the sorceress Shailyn, did she have answers - a way of lifting this damned curse?
"Yes, by shattering these bone talismans."
So these talismans are infused with the warrior's fire stolen by Faceless?
Interesting, each talisman bears a sigil similar to those etched on both Aidyn's back and my own… but there's not a direct match here.
"Faceless himself may have yours."
Just our luck, right? Still, it's nice to think smashing these will restore the might of other warriors.
I'll settle for that satisfaction now, and I'll hope we find either Aidyn or Faceless before they find each other.
<g id="g_grace_headtilthmm" />You know, after bumping around the island for so many months, this is the first time I've felt at home since I lost my ship.
<g id="g_grace_nicememory" />With a little extra coin, we'll turn this place into a right proper estate, I think.
(This table looks like it could be used to destroy the bone talismans.)
(This table looks like it could be used to destroy the bone talismans.)
(Destroy the bone talismans)
As you crush the bones, you sense power being released back to the victims.
(Use this table to destroy Varangian Bone Talismans)
I feel as if your warrior's fire has rekindled a beacon I'd lost sight of - hope.
Here I am talking to Skye like she's some young girl from Cork, but in truth, she's got centuries on me.
She's been on the island since before Cork was even on the map! Still can't wrap my head around it!
"She still has a youthful spirit."
That she does, and she needs our help, that's for sure. Poor thing, losing Aidyn, her only friend in the world.
What say we recruit some new Crows to widen her social circle?
The Best of Aeternum
The Silver Crows need more members. Work with Grace to find additional heroes to join the group.
<g id="g_grace_proud" />Now I've known you long enough to tell. Something's bothering you, isn't it?
"When are we hiring more Crows?"
<g id="g_grace_realize" />Matter of fact, I was just heading over to Mourningdale to post up some recruiting notices.<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> Care to join me?
"Why Mourningdale?"
<g id="g_grace_no" />Well we've got to start somewhere.<g id="g_grace_crossarmsinsulted" /> The way I see it, we need people with the mettle to sail through bad weather.
<g id="g_grace_sorry" />And there's nowhere on Aeternum with worse weather than Mourningdale.
<g id="g_grace_headtilthmm" />When I was Captain of the Satisfaction, I left the recruiting to the First Mate,<g id="g_grace_shrugdontknow" /> thought it was a simple task, you know?
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />Turns out it's a wee bit more difficult finding quality people…<g id="g_grace_handheart" /> especially with you and me kinda setting the standard.
"I can help with recruiting too."
<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" />Well now, that'd be most welcome, posting flyers and<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> conducting these interviews could be<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" /> a team effort.
<g id="g_grace_consider" />I've been poking around different settlements, I think Mourningdale's the best place to recruit.
<g id="g_grace_headtilthmm" />I can tell you don't like the idea of finding true talent by posting notices.<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> But you'll see, it's a mercenary company tradition.
Travel to Mourningdale to recruit new members for the Silver Crows
Post Silver Crows recruitment flyers in Grayvale Hamlet
By the Spirit Shrine
In the Artisan's Courtyard
Near the Town Hall
Meet Grace O'Malley at the tavern to interview candidates for the Silver Crows
<g id="g_grace_spreadarms" />There you are! I guess you must've gotten all those notices posted, because we got people lining up already.
<g id="g_grace_no" />Not sure this is the best Aeternum has to offer - some of these volunteers seem a bit a dodgy.
"We have to start somewhere."
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />Now you're throwing my lines back at me?<g id="g_grace_crossarmsinsulted" /> Never miss a chance to give me shite, do you?
<g id="g_grace_flirt" />So it is, though. We'll see what these folks have to say for themselves… let's just keep our<g id="g_grace_gesturelefts" /> expectations… low.
Alright, let's bring on the candidates then, shall we?
There you are! Been waiting for you to get started. Already got a few candidates lined up!
All right, who's first? Step up and let's hear your qualifications.
When I defeated the Tempest--
Next!
I am a great admirer of your mercenary company. To me, the Iron Rose has-- is this not the interviews for the Iron Rose?
I am a great admirer of your mercenary company.
To me, the Iron Rose has--
Is this not the interviews for the Iron Rose?
No it's not- next!
After years of meticulous study, I finally know the secret of the Ancients! They came from the future!
After years of meticulous study, I finally know the secret of the Ancients!
They came from the future!
Alright, we're done here. Ahh, this was a mistake, to be fair.
Oh, I don't shake hands.
Ah! You're to be my little junior Crow, are you? Well met, indeed!
Iron Rose, Silver Crows - anyone would have mixed the two.
Perhaps you'd consider renaming your group to the "Iron Crows." Has more of a "Let your blade shine a light in the dark," feel to it.
Is it so ludicrous a notion to think the Ancients could come from the future? Just think on it.
<g id="g_grace_no" />Clearly, that was not the best of Aeternum.
<g id="g_grace_sorry" />I could tell you didn't like this idea to begin with, and you were right. We need another way.
Zander the Undying
Grace has a great candidate in mind. Locate Zander the Undying and convince him to join the Crows.
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />Believe it or not,<g id="g_grace_convince2" /> I've got a strong candidate to be our next Crow - a real mean fellow, an enforcer known as "Zander the Undying."
<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" />So tough, he's yet to die even once.<g id="g_grace_concerns" /> He's been mauled, shot, poisoned, but never died.
"Impressive. Where's Zander now?"
<g id="g_grace_secret" />Word is, he's left his old employer, a bit of a shady outfit, but that might not be so terrible.
<g id="g_grace_understand" />Zander's hunkered down in a small cabin over in Edengrove. He's expecting you, so go talk to him and then<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" /> you make the call.
<g id="g_grace_headtilthmm" />This Zander character seems like he'd round out our team pretty well.<g id="g_grace_yes" /> Let me know what you think.
Find Zander the Undying
Speak to Zander the Undying in Edengrove about joining the Silver Crows
Ahh! No! No claw! Listen to me, baby cat. Scratch me one more time, and I will bake you into a pie. It will be very hot, and sugary, and-- OW!
Ahh! No! No claw! Listen to me, baby cat-
Scratch me one more time, and I will bake you into a pie.
It will be very hot, and sugary, and-- OW!
<g id="g_female_notsure" />Hm, so you're the boss of the Silver Crows, eh? Yes of course, I have heard of you and your mighty deeds.
<g id="g_male_compliment" />You're the infamous commander who came to Aeternum on a ship, and upon landing,<g id="g_male_headshakeno" /> tragically fell to Corruption.
"That's Thorpe. I defeated him."

<g id="g_female_nodyes" />Hm. Even more impressive!<g id="g_female_fingerwagno" /> But I cannot join the Crows right now -<g id="g_male_gesturebackthere" priority="high" /> this sick little kitty has a greenish color and needs my help.
<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" />What can I do? Little fellow's too weak to bring to a healer, and I<g id="g_male_headshakeno" /> cannot leave him here alone.
"I'll get some medicine for him."
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />Well now, that would be very good of you. Find<g id="g_female_nodyes" /> Eynon the Druid - he'll have something to treat him.
<g id="g_male_nodsympathysmall" />Brave little kitty! Our new friend's going to get you some medicine… don't you worry.
<g id="g_male_wavehandsno" />Even on Aeternum, I do not think of death lightly. Who knows what is<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" bin="1" bout="1.5" /> taken from you when you die?
<g id="g_male_explain" />Are you truly the same person? Or someone else, using your body,<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" /> thinking your thoughts. It is… unsettling.
(The baby lynx kitten greets you with a weak meow. He seems to like you.)
Talk to Eynon the Druid about getting medicine for the baby lynx
If you're a hunter, hoping to trick me into giving you the location of some creature's den, don't bother. I'm wise to that.
If you're hoping to learn how to talk to animals, there's a waiting list… and it's long.
"Can you cure a poisoned lynx?"
Oh no, another one with the green complexion? First a goat with potato eyes, then a bear with ears of corn!
Animals turning into plants… nature's a trickster, even for a druid, but I'd say someone's behind this.
"Do you have a cure?"
Oh… yes. This recipe is for a treat to reverse the process, but don't let the kitty near water for two days after they eat it. You're welcome.
Remember, Eynon heals all animals. Except squirrels, the dirty little hoarders.
Yes, I know, the typical druid, standing under an overlarge tree! That's what I am.
But let me just say, I do not prance about in nothing but laurel leaves, and I hold no love for squirrels.
Gather ingredients for Eynon's Purifying Pâté anti-toxin
Gather Azoth Sap from Extractors
Collect a Gator Liver from Black Alligators
Collect Verdant Essence from Angry Earth
Craft Eynon's Purifying Pâté at a Kitchen or at your Camp
Return the Purifying Pâté to Zander
(The baby lynx kitten purrs. He seems to recognize you.)
<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" />Thank you, my friend. This is very clever, making a treat to heal the kitty-cat.
<g id="g_male_pointblame" />I must think about this some more. Perhaps I can create a<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" /> new recipe or two of my own for the little fellow.
"You like to cook?"
<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" />Of course! What about me does not suggest that I love to cook?
<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />Everyone knows me as Zander the Baker, yes?<g id="g_female_notsure" /> Ah, just wait until you try my lemon cakes.
<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" />Of course! What about me does not suggest that I love to cook?

<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />Everyone knows me as Zander the Baker, yes?<g id="g_female_notsure" /> Ah, just wait until you try my lemon cakes. Oh, I guess that means I'll join you.<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> Go on, I'll meet you there.
Canon and Coin
Help Zander find a way out of his organization.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />About your Silver Crows, I would like to join, but there's a slight problem.
<g id="g_female_youknow" />My current employer, Granny Pike, she gets… attached.<g id="g_male_concerns" /> She buried a man alive for a day after he was thinking of leaving her employ.
"What happened to him?"
<g id="g_female_headnodding" />You are speaking to him. After she released me,<g id="g_female_spreadarms" /> she said I could take time away, but leaving would never be an option.
<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />Maybe you can change her mind? It's up to you, but<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" /> without her approval, I'm stuck.
<g id="g_male_itsokay" />If you talk to Granny, be… diplomatic.<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" /> I can still hear the sound of dirt hitting the lid of that coffin.
Talk to Zander's former employer, "Granny"
Oh, I know who you are - you've been talking to Zander. Yes, Granny has eyes everywhere. Don’t forget it.
And you can give up on recruiting Zander. He won't join your little band of greedy do-gooders.
"Won't or can't?"
Clever, you. Too clever gets the cleaver, hm? Alright, you've got steel in your spine.
Do me a favor, and I'll consider it. There's a church in Calvary, in Brightwood, it's under construction… for years now.
"Why for so long?"
That's what I want to know. Our organization's paying to rebuild it - we see it as a way of giving back to the community.
But someone's skimming our funds. Find the thief, recover our coin, and we'll talk about Zander.
Ah, Zander, I'm too soft on that child. Having a kind heart won't do him any favors in this world.
Visit the Calvary church to investigate thefts
Interview the guards for clues
Sent you with replacement funds, did they? Well let me tell you what I think-- Shut your trap Amis, what do you know?
I say it's that lurking priest! He took the money, so they don't have to pay the builders!
"How does that help the church?"
Yeah, well, I'm still sorting it all out, but it's coming clear, all right.
Clear as the wind coming through those great big holes in the roof!
Some people think money don't matter on Aeternum. They're wrong. How'd you like to be poor forever? We still want to eat, right?
You know, have to hang our coat up somewhere. Think about it.
Sure, put the coin inside, but Marty and me are taking a break soon. Here, last time, we weren't gone more than a few minutes, and it disappeared.
It's one of those specters we seen out on the moors, I swear it!
"Why would a specter need coin?"
Don't you know about Brightwood? How they used to bury people alive?
So now there's one of them back for revenge, figures we owe him for all the suffering he's been through.
Have you heard? That pirate lady's got a new crew going by the name of the Silver Crows.
Wonder if they might hire on me and Marty. I mean, I'm a fair shot. As long as the target don't move around.
Ask the priest about the stolen funds
If you're here with money from Granny, leave it in the cabinet on the far wall, and thank you for your service.
Sad isn't it? We came to this land of plentiful life and bounty, and yet - and yet our greed, ambition, hunger - nothing changed, did it?
"Some money has gone missing?"
It could be anyone. The guards, Beatris, myself, none of us make much coin. Ah, but I'm not sure my opinion matters.
I'm just happy they decided to restart the construction. It will be joyous to see this place restored.
May the Spark watch over you, my friend. I hope you find succor and company here in our humble house, such as it is.
Store the fake funds in the cabinet
Now that you've planted the funds, find a good vantage point to watch for the thief. Perhaps the rooftop…
Find a good spot to watch for the thief

string.comment: (if it helps, these would be the words: "Ohhh, if you want a girl who can dance and sing, sew pretty lace of some birds on the wing…")
string.speaker: Dicun Hobday
string.name: DicunHobday

resources.string: Daaah, ta da da da da daa da da daa da daahh, dah dah dah hm hm hm hm hmmm…
Confront Dicun about stealing the funds
Ah! My goodness but you gave me quite the start! Funny that you're here. I was just checking to make sure your funds were secure.
"I saw you taking the coin."
Oh no! No, no! Have mercy, please, don't tell Granny!
I haven't touched a coin of what I took before, you'll see, I'll tell you where I hid it!
It may sound pathetic to you, for an old man like me to say I've changed, but it's true.
You've allowed me to redeem myself. And I will. I'll make sure you are rewarded for your faith in me.
Travel to Brightwood Isle to find Dicun's hidden loot
Recover Granny's funds from Brightwood Isle so she'll let Zander join your team
It sounds like Dicun's voice outside the cabin- has he followed you here?
Investigate the voice you heard
Catch Dicun!
Time remaining: {timeRemaining}
It seems that Dicun's gone for now. And good riddance.

string.comment: Dicun shrieks as he runs from the player
string.speaker: Dicun Hobday
string.name: DicunHobday

resources.string: Ah! How did you escape from there?

string.comment: Dicun shrieks as he runs from the player
string.speaker: Dicun Hobday
string.name: DicunHobday

resources.string: Ahh! No!!

string.comment: Dicun gives up as he's caught by the player running
string.speaker: Dicun Hobday
string.name: DicunHobday

resources.string: All right, all right, y-you caught me! I'll make a full confession, I swear it!
Return the church renovation funds to Granny
You recovered the stolen funds, I see. You're as clever as I had you figured to be. Now, what say you tell me who was the culprit?
"Who cares? You got your money."
Ha! I get it! You're running your own little protection racket now, are you?
I was going to hire you, but there's only enough room for one big fish in this pond. So get on with you - our deal is one and done.
"What about Zander?"
Fine. He's yours, for now. Tell him Granny Pike said-- Ah, damned dust. Go on, leave me be, child.
If it isn't the Clever Cleaver. How's my Zander doing?
Don't be too soft on him, it's not good for that boy.
Meet Zander at the Crow's Nest where he's gone to await Granny's answer
<g id="g_male_shocked" />Granny Pike told you that I could join the Silver Crows?<g id="g_male_compliment" /> You are an incredible wonder. I feel the urge to hug you with all my strength.
"Maybe later... Glad you're here!"
<g id="g_male_headnodyes" />Thank you. For<g id="g_male_willcoverit" /> the second time in my life, I feel I have met a true friend.
The Silver Crows
Zander the Undying and Dog
You've recruited Zander the Undying and Dog to join your team
(Tell Zander about the priest)
<g id="g_female_nodyes" />And you also made the priest make a confession?<g id="g_male_laugh" /> Ah ha ha! That is what they call a "metaphor," my friend.
"I think it's ironic."
<g id="g_female_youknow" />Yes, it is also that.
<g id="g_grace_no" />No, Zander, we don't have a kitchen here, you can use the fire and a stick like everyone else.
<g id="g_grace_throwarms" />Just arrived and he's already making demands.<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> Don't you start getting any ideas, all right?
This place may be<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" /> small, but I feel it has a big heart.
<g id="g_female_nodyes" />There is a great warmth here, that speaks of family.
(The baby lynx kitten meows happily. You'd swear he was thanking you. He looks a lot better!)
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />First off, great work getting Zander to sign on, he'll be a great add to our team.
<g id="g_grace_doubt" />Second, that mangy dog he brought? It has to go.
"It's a baby lynx."
<g id="g_grace_frustrated" />Dog…. Lynx... whatever it is, it has fleas, which is why I made Zander<g id="g_grace_gesturerighthand" /> put it all the way over there.
<g id="g_grace_noway" />The loathsome little thing keeps trying to sneak into my bedroll. I feel itchy just thinking about it.
Supply Chains
Work with the Crows to track down the Varangian warlock, Faceless.
So, I was talking to Skye about what happened, how Faceless came and stole her warrior's fire.
Doesn't it seem strange to you that he took the time to show up in person, when he wants to empower his whole army?
"Could he be testing his curse?"
Exactly! And the other thing we can guess is, he had to be there in person to curse them.
Which means, now that he's making hundreds of those filthy talismans…
"He needs a lot of warriors."
You're getting this a lot faster than we did. Anyhow, I checked with some acquaintances.
There's a smuggler "recruiting warriors" in Valor Hold, hundreds they say. Let's follow the rat to the cheese, shall we?
Once we find this warlock-- Well, just, be careful. It's not like I've got piles of friends like you lying about.
Check in on Skye
I used to be sure in a fight, of my feet, my spear, my breath. Now, there’s a doubt. I feel I might miss, and I do. I stumble on a rock I knew was there.
Yet, I still want the fight! And that’s worst of all.
"Don't worry. We'll fix this."
Will we? If only I could help! If I could just fight! Or even have enough strength to go and search for Aidyn.
Tell me. If it were you, and you felt despair's icy grip at your throat, what would you do?
"I'd take what small step I could."
Indeed. It might be, my conversation with Grace, could be the small step that leads us to strike true in our hunt.
Thank you, friend. Once more, you've put my mind at ease.
"I'd wear a muffler."
Only you would make me smile at a time like this, in my most desperate of hours.
You have a gift, friend, of putting my heart at ease. Thank you.
"I would confide in a friend."
Ah, that. I'm sorry, I'll not shed a tear for myself, how unseemly.
I'm grateful for your friendship, and for the strength it provides. More than you can possibly know.
Alright, pull yourself together, Skye. You've got this.
Travel to Valor Hold in Edengrove to look for the smuggler
Question the smuggler for clues on Faceless's location
Track down the smuggler
Examine the footprints
The tracks are fresh, and look about the right size for the smuggler.
Follow Frank's trail
Examine the tracks
The footprints seem to lead toward an abandoned shack.
Hey, aren't you the one who… yeah you're the one - a real hero, they say.
Don't know what you're doing talking to me, but you gotta move along. I got business to take care of.
"Are you looking for warriors?"
Yeah… Not of your ilk. I'm specifically looking for the less… heroic type.
I got no bone to pick with you, just asking you to mind your own business.
What do you want?
Move along.
Ask Frank where he's taking the kidnapped warriors
Damn it all! How'd you find me? You just won't leave well enough alone, will you?
If you're here hoping to collect that bounty on my head, you're wasting your time - someone already killed me and claimed it!
"I just want the truth…"
Oh, that? You can ask all day, but I'm not talking. Go ahead and do your worst.
You're dealing with Fearless Frank - I been killed so many times, there's nothing that'll give me even a sliver of fear.
"Then tell me."
Hm... Yeah, I guess you got a point. I don't fear death, but that warlock makes me queasy. If I'm being honest, I never liked this whole abduction scheme.
Tell you what, I'll mark the spot on your map where I'm supposed to make the exchange… and I wash my hands of it!
Oh, I'm still fearless. I just decided, free of fear, to share what I know.
And I already told you everything I know, so go away!
Free the captured warriors and look for information on Faceless
Find the kidnapped warriors
Rescue the prisoner
Free the first prisoner
Free the second prisoner
Defeat the Varangian guards to get a key for the cage
Free the prisoner in the cage
Thank you, friend! These Varangians were brutal captors.
Zander's thorough, I'll give him that. And every bit as scary as I thought he'd be.
The fact that he bakes delicious lemon cakes makes him even more terrifying somehow.
Check with Grace for any new leads on Faceless
I guess Frank discovered his conscience, he came by to spill his "fearless" guts about the operation.
Zander's having a chat with him to find out what he knows.
"Should I talk to him?"
Ah, don't get caught up in the rigging, we'll take care of things here.
I'll let you know what we find out about Faceless, back at the Crow's Nest.
The Possibilities of Fire
Strange growths have appeared near the Crow's Nest. Grace is asking you to investigate and get rid of them.
By the way, we're having a bit of a problem around the camp. Seems like there's some kind of strange… things, growing.
If you've got a few minutes to spare, maybe you could have a look.
"What kind of strange growths?"
The kind associated with those elemental rotters… the Furious Earth, or whatever they're called.
Strange as it may be, Zander seems to know a thing or two about plants - maybe ask him about it.
Things are much worse than I thought.
Come talk to me once you're done with those vines.
Talk to Zander about the camp's greenery problem
Are those strange vines out there making you as nervous as they're making me? Like nothing I've ever seen before.
I've been cutting them down as soon as they sprout, but for the big ones, it might take something with a little more punch.
"They might put up a fight."
My thinking, too, and they'll fight dirty. But I got just the thing! A recipe, but not for eating.
"Fire Dressing," I call it. Haha! Try that on those giant vines. That'll cook them all right, and then maybe we could eat them... Maybe?
Gather ingredients for Zander's Fire Dressing (weapon coating)
Collect Luimous Solvent from Any Corrupted
Collect Cinderquartz from Any Ancient Guardian
Craft Zander's Fire Dressing using a Workshop or your Camp
Use Zander's Fire Dressing on your weapons
Investigate the growth on the outskirts of the Crow's Nest
Clear the mysterious growth on the outskirts of the Crow's Nest
Destroy the vine roots
Cull the Furious vine guardians

string.comment: Do not record- but need loc and would like a SFX meow
string.speaker: Dog
string.name: DogTheKitten

resources.string: (Dog meows plaintively at you. He looks worried about something.)
It is a puzzle. Outside of Aeternum, animals only fight to survive. On Aeternum, they march to war.
But who strikes the drum? And how do they hear it?
It worked? That is good. But who is it that twists Nature in this way? Innocent animals suffer, and now even plants are made to struggle against us.
When I find who does this, they will suffer as the kitty did.
Dearly Beloved
Skye's lover Aidyn has been spotted. Find her as soon as possible.
Ah! With those vines wrapping around my brain, I forgot! The spear-woman got all nervous and angry.
I think maybe her mate got captured. Aidyn, I think? Something about her face… I forget.
"Did Faceless capture Aidyn?"
Ah, yes! That's it! Fearful Frank told us of a cave in Edengrove.
Grace sent scouts there. They saw Aidyn taken there by Faceless and several soldiers.
I think you should find the spear-woman quickly… before she gets in trouble.
Ah, thank the stars you're here! They got Aidyn, and as you can see, Skye's ready for battle, or at least she thinks she is.
Between you and I, I'm not sure how long Aidyn'll last in that cave. You'd best be going.
"Skye needs to stay here."
True, she's in no condition to fight, doubting herself and all. I'll talk to her as a distraction, and you just slip away to do the deed.
Hurry though, I don't think I'll be able to delay her for long.
Remember what I said about playing it safe.
A couple of coins isn't worth you getting cursed like Skye.
I will not stand by while they torture Aidyn!
You must let me go! Tell Grace to give me the location where they're holding her!
"I'll handle it. Trust me."
I know. With this curse, it's just that nothing ever feels right, always this sense of impending doom!
Please, help Aidyn. And don't try to stop me from coming too!
Grace! Give me Aidyn's location!
I don't want to fight you, but I will if you don't tell me!
Look for Aidyn
Rescue Aidyn

string.comment: he's toying with Aidyn as she swings at him and misses, also as he zaps her with teases of his power
string.speaker: Faceless
string.name: Faceless

resources.string: Heeheehee! Hehehe! Haha! HA HA HA!

string.comment: (various smaller screams of pain as Aidyn gets zapped with smaller lashes of power)
string.speaker: Aidyn
string.name: Aidyn

resources.string: Uhh! Euhhh! Ahh! Nnh!

string.comment: more desperate version of wild swings
string.speaker: Aidyn
string.name: Aidyn

resources.string: Ahh! Haaah! Mmph! Ha! Hraaah!

string.comment: Faceless full blast zaps Aidyn right after saying this.
string.speaker: Faceless
string.name: Faceless

resources.string: Your fire is mine.

string.comment: this is the main beat where Faceless zaps her with the curse power to make her into a fighting monstrosity- it knocks her to her knees
string.speaker: Aidyn
string.name: Aidyn

resources.string: Ahhhh! No!!

string.comment: he's addressing this also indirectly to player as a taunt
string.speaker: Faceless
string.name: Faceless

resources.string: Pathetic.

string.comment: Note that Skye is not present - Aidyn runs in the opposite direction as Faceless at end of this line and the player runs after her. Aidyn says "stay back" because she can't control the powers that are taking her over, Faceless is turning her into a mad berserker
string.speaker: Aidyn
string.name: Aidyn

resources.string: No! Stay back… I'm sorry, Skye!

string.comment: (combat grunts, rage, power up - this is her "monstrous" version so perhaps voice can be distorted with all the warrior power she received from Faceless- she's turned mad at this point)
string.speaker: Aidyn
string.name: Aidyn

resources.string: This is your doing!

string.comment: (combat grunts, rage, power up - this is her "monstrous" version so perhaps voice can be distorted with all the warrior power she received from Faceless- she's turned mad at this point)
string.speaker: Aidyn
string.name: Aidyn

resources.string: Haaaa!! Mph! Ha! Heuh! Ha!

string.comment: (note that she's going insane at this point from the "dark side" power coursing through her, so she thinks the player is Faceless at times, etc.)
string.speaker: Aidyn
string.name: Aidyn

resources.string: You will not take Skye from me!

string.comment: (combat grunts, rage, power up - this is her "monstrous" version so perhaps voice can be distorted with all the warrior power she received from Faceless- she's turned mad at this point)
string.speaker: Aidyn
string.name: Aidyn

resources.string: This power-- too many speak in my mind!
No!
Euh! Ah! Ohh! Nnh!
Hup! Ha!
Timed placeholder for scripted event
Go after Aidyn
Fight Aidyn
Poor Aidyn. What she had to go through, all thanks to that shite bastard Faceless.
Cat's curse on him. If only we'd been a step quicker.
Faceless
Skye has gone after Faceless by herself. Find the Varangian warlock and destroy him.
Listen, Skye's gone after Faceless. I sent Zander after her, but-
Don't look at me like that, I'd like to see you try to stop that woman and her spear from doing whatever they want!
"Do we know where they're going?"
They're headed to a Varangian fortress south of here, I'll mark it on your map.
We'd best get moving and find Skye. Don't want a repeat of what happened to Aidyn. I'll meet you there.
You and I always get caught up in the biggest storms. But we always sail clear, don't we?
Go to the Varangian Fortress to look for Skye
Search the Fortress for Skye
You've spotted Skye outside the Fortress. Go talk to her.
I went at Faceless with everything I had. All the strength that my rage, my loss, my hate would lend me.
He just laughed, and struck me aside as if I were a toy.
"I'll get back your fire."
I believe you. Crush that bastard… for what he did to me, and what he did to Aidyn.
When you're done, and I've got my fire back, then it'll be my turn.
Be wary of his curse powers.
I'd not like seeing another friend fall to that snake's poison.
The spear woman is badly wounded.
Don't worry, I will keep her safe for you.
"For me?"
It is simple. I do what I do, for me, also for you.
His mask does not frighten me. Only a coward hides behind deception.
But magic. Magic, I do not understand. It is not something you can hold in your hands.
(Dog meows at you, as if asking if you're all right.)
"Protect Skye and Zander, okay?"
(Dog's chest puffs up with pride. His eyes seem to say, "Of course.")
(Dog's ears flicker, alert for enemies. You get the feeling he's protecting Skye and Zander.)
Defeat Faceless
Welcome, hero. I can hardly wait to taste your warrior's fire!
Ahhh, your power is delicious!
Ha ha ha ha ha! Ahahaha!
Ha! Haa! Hrr! Hmph!
Ohh! Ahh! Uhh!
Enough toying about! Let me teach you the taste of defeat.
Haaa! Hmph! Ha! Hoh!
No! How can this be?
You've avenged me. I am forever in your debt.
If only Aidyn were here to share this feeling.
Haha! We have defeated our enemy. But on this island, people die and return to life.
Have we seen the last of Faceless, or will he return?
(Dog meows happily, and licks someone's blood off his chin.)
Never doubted you for a second, mate.
See you back at the Crow's Nest!
Would that I could feel my spear rip through the back of his neck, and smile at him as he choked on his own blood.
Still, you've avenged me. Thank you, once again. I will never forget all that you've done.
To Be Continued?
Wrap up your contract with Skye.
Wait, is that…? That sigil… it matches the one on my back. And Aidyn's as well.
Our warrior's fire! Gods, but I'm still nervous somehow… what if it doesn't work?
"Let's find out back at camp."
For so long, Aidyn's been the arm I lean on… and now she's gone.
Your support through all this, it's more… it's more than I hoped for. Let's go then.
Whatever happens next, I thank you, friend.
For everything you've done for me.
Destroy the cursed bone talisman at camp
(You place the talisman on the table, a powerful aura radiating from the grisly sigils etched into bone).
(Smash Skye's talisman)
A thunderclap of energy rocks the camp.
You sense the power of the remaining victims being freed from Faceless' curse.
(As you look at the table, you feel the satisfaction of knowing that you've freed the strength of many warriors.)
Ah, it is incredible, to feel my warrior's power again!
Whole. Alive. Ahh, I want to battle again! Could I ask one last favor of you?
"Are you asking to fight?"
Oh! Now that you say it, the idea's sorely tempting! Just a friendly little contest, of course, lasting no more than a few days.
But no, I had only hoped to speak with you, privately.
I feel incredible! To have my strength back, and the doubt I once had, is gone, like a bad dream.
You've given everything to me. Thank you again.
Meet Skye to hear what she has to say
Join Skye at the viewpoint
This is a timed placeholder for a short scripted event
I found this place, long ago. It's special to me.
I used to think that strength was the only measure of a person.
Because of you, I see there are many forms of strength. And I see something else, as well.
Ah ha ha!
Ha ha!
(Meow!)
I see your friends.
We saw you both leave the Crow's Nest, so we were just… worried, is all it was.
Hope we didn't interrupt anything interesting. Did we?
I do not understand why you people are so shy. When my mother met my father, she threw him over her shoulder, carried him to her home, and--
Actually, she always stopped there when she told that story.
(Dog looks at you with big, innocent eyes.)
That was a misstep, to-- It's just, all the feelings I have, I mean, from the things you've done for me.
Defeating Faceless, winning back my strength. Well, I should be going.
"It'll be strange, without you."
I'll take my first small steps to rediscover who I am. You've changed me, and cleared my path.
I will spend some time in the mountains, thinking. I hope we may meet again, if fate allows.
Then I may give you a muffler, to remember me. I will spend some time in the mountains, thinking.
Perhaps we'll meet again. I only hope your jokes are better next time.
I could not have asked for a better friend. I will spend some time in the mountains, thinking.
After that time, if it might please you to seek me out, I hope you do. I would welcome your company, any time.
Meeting you was a great thing. I have enjoyed working with you, my friend.
And one day very soon, you will try one of my lemon cakes. You will never wish to eat another living creature again!
"Are you vegetarian?"
No, I am Zander. But I find my mind is weakened by eating animals. Because I eat only plants, my mind is always this sharp.
Although, I do sometimes eat a squirrel. They are so stupid they're basically plants.
(As Dog looks at you, you think back on his actions, and start to realize he may be much smarter than you thought.)
"How did you find that fortress?"
(You could swear he winked.)
Well, captain, we started the Crows, finished our first contract, and smooth sailing at every turn.
All thanks to someone's perfect planning and coordination.
"You mean someone else doing it."
All the work? The nerve! How do you even fit that galleon-sized head through doorways?
Regardless, a job well done. Oh, and I hope you like hot weather…
You've found me! Well, this is exciting. There isn't a day that goes by that I don't think of you.
Mostly about our promised battle, but sometimes, other things as well.
The Empyrean Forge (Expedition)
Shailyn wants to uncover what Loth and his Varangians are doing in the Forge. Help her find Loth.
Your aura radiates a strength I've not seen in many, many years. There is a task, a heroic undertaking I must request of you.
You must help me defeat one of the Knights of the Round Table.
"Why would you want that?"
Because he has given in to madness and savagery, joined with the Varangians.
Ser Loth is who I speak of, and within the Empyrean Forge, his forces seek to claim a power that could be the unmaking of us all.
"What power is Loth seeking?"
An elemental force older even than the Ancients who built this structure in their twisted effort to control it.
Ser Loth and his allies would use this primal fire to reforge themselves as warriors of devastating might.
"Then how do I stop them?"
By any means necessary. If anyone has the potential, I sense it is you.
Strike through our enemies to the heart of the Forge, and if any have received its full power… gods help us, just do what you can.
I await news of your success, young one.
Enter the Empyrean Forge to find and stop Loth
Defeat Commander Marius

string.comment: Not sure if this line got recorded - it was in Shailyn's script
string.speaker: Ser Marius
string.name: Marius

resources.string: You are too late. Our master Ser Loth will seize the eldritch power that courses through these halls.

string.comment: Not sure if this line got recorded - it was in Shailyn's script
string.speaker: Ser Marius
string.name: Marius

resources.string: I am to rid this world of the likes of you. Come and witness a taste of the power our lord will soon claim!
I watched from afar and saw Ser Loth's Varangian allies in quite a disarray. Whatever you accomplished in there - it must've worked.
Tell me, though, had any of them acquired the full power of the Forge?
"Yes, but I defeated him."
That is a battle I would've liked to witness. You're as strong as I sensed.
If that loathsome serpent Loth escaped, I fear he will only pursue this endeavor with less restraint, but for today, I celebrate your victory.
A Toymaker's Request (Expedition)
Otmar is interested in collecting rare Apatite Gems to make runeglass to make his "toys." Help him find the gems in the Empyrean Forge.
Yes, hello, I'm sorry, I was just thinking about a new design for a toy.
Otmar Winkler, of Winkler's Wonders. Ah, would you be going into the Empyrean Forge?
"I might."
Such providence! I am interested in obtaining Apatite Gems only found in the Forge.
You see, I use them to construct runeglass containers which can highly enhance the conductivity-- Ja, well, in short, to make my toys.
Did you know, I originally tried to run a sweets shop. Winkler's Aeternal Sweetmeats.
My favorite was the candied Spriggan liver. Ah, but my customers only cared for the toys.
Splendid work my friend. If business continues to swell I may need your services again soon.
Stand back or I'll-- Oh thank goodness, you're not one of those Forged, are you?
Fortunately, I was already hiding when they made their way to this area. Did Leonie give up and send you to find me?
"No, we’re searching for a way in."
Oh! I can help with that. I love puzzles, and well, the Ancients!
You'll just need to go in the other room, there's a puzzle in there I haven't figured out yet. Let me just unlock this device for you to activate it.
Venture into the Empyrean Forge to Gather Apatite Gems for Otmar
Gather Gem from the Reliquary
Defeat Marius and Escape with the Gems
Wonderful, you found the gems! Oh, you are-- well, a wonder!
With this, I can create at least two more Corrupted Ogre golems. And yes, yes, the eyes light up red, of course!
Gather Gem from the Foundry
Gather Gem from the Control Room
